content:
• Monday, July 30, 2012
  • KONA

    More on Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): FQ1 easily beats on solid sales growth numbers. Restaurant...

    More on Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): FQ1 easily beats on solid sales growth numbers. Restaurant sales +8.6% to $24.2M. Same-store sales +8.7%, compared with +7.6% in the prior year period. Gross margin widened to 73.1% from 72%. Shares +5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) trade at their lows late in the after hours session, -18.3% to...

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) trade at their lows late in the after hours session, -18.3% to $5.03 after resuming trade earlier at $5.69.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOOG

    Two startling figures within Strategy Analytics' Q2 U.S. smartphone data: Android's...

    Two startling figures within Strategy Analytics' Q2 U.S. smartphone data: Android's (NASDAQ:GOOG) share fell 430 bps Y/Y to 56.3%, and total sales fell 5.4% Y/Y. The iPhone's (NASDAQ:AAPL) share surged 1000 bps to 33.2%. Apple's incredible customer loyalty helped it take share in a relatively saturated U.S. market, but as IDC's Q2 data shows, things were a little different internationally, where there are more first-time buyers and users are often more price-sensitive.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • MAS

    More on Masco (NYSE:MAS): shares are hit in the post session after its Q2 missed on both top and...

    More on Masco (NYSE:MAS): shares are hit in the post session after its Q2 missed on both top and bottom-line estimates. Revenue was flat Y/Y, hit by litigation charges and higher material costs, which cut into margins and masked better home construction activity and higher sales of plumbing products in its North American segment, along with general selling price increases. Shares -9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • SPN

    Superior Energy (NYSE:SPN) -9.9% AH after reporting Q2 profit that edged estimates while cutting...

    Superior Energy (NYSE:SPN) -9.9% AH after reporting Q2 profit that edged estimates while cutting its full-year earnings outlook, seeing EPS of $2.75-$3.05 vs. $3.30-$3.60 guidance and $3.16 consensus. "Continued low natural gas prices, a lower realized crude oil price and significant reductions in natural gas liquids prices are impacting our customers' cash flows," CEO David Dunlap says.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • MAS

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2B (flat Y/Y) misses by $80M....

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2B (flat Y/Y) misses by $80M. Shares -9% AH. (PR )
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) declares $0.32/share quarterly dividend, 28% increase from prior...

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) declares $0.32/share quarterly dividend, 28% increase from prior dividend of $0.25. Forward yield 4.21%. For shareholders of record Aug 14. Payable Aug 29. Ex-div date Aug 10. Shares -8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • EMN

    More on Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN): Q2 beats on the bottom line but misses at the top on a...

    More on Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN): Q2 beats on the bottom line but misses at the top on a decline in total revenue. Net profit was -17% Y/Y due largely to transaction and integration costs related to its Solutia acquisition. The company reaffirmed its FY12 forecast. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo (NASDAQ:ASIA): Q2 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $126.3M (+12.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.9M....

    AsiaInfo (NASDAQ:ASIA): Q2 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $126.3M (+12.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.9M. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue of $4B, -11% Q/Q...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue of $4B, -11% Q/Q and easily below a $4.62B consensus. Gross margin is expected to fall another 360 bps Q/Q to 30%. The numbers contrast greatly with Western Digital's strong FY13 forecast. STX now -7.1% AH. WDC -1.6%. Chip suppliers LSI-OLD and Marvell (MRVL - previous) could also see weakness. Also: Seagate has hired Micron (NASDAQ:MU) enterprise solid-state drive (SSD) chief Gary Gentry to run its SSD unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • TXRH

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q2 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $320.5M (+14.6% Y/Y)...

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q2 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $320.5M (+14.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • RTEC

    Rudolph Technologies (NASDAQ:RTEC): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $53.3M (+9.3%...

    Rudolph Technologies (NASDAQ:RTEC): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $53.3M (+9.3% Y/Y) misses by $0.5M. Shares +15.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • RLD

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $68.2M (+14.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $68.2M (+14.4% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -19% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • HUM

    More on Humana (NYSE:HUM): Q2 misses on all fronts as higher operating costs overshadowed better...

    More on Humana (NYSE:HUM): Q2 misses on all fronts as higher operating costs overshadowed better total revenue. The company also cuts FY12 EPS estimates drastically, now expecting to earn between $6.90 to $7.10, far below its previous estimate of $7.38 to $7.58. Street consensus EPS estimates are for $7.93 per share. Shares -11.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • FLS

    Flowserve (NYSE:FLS): Q2 EPS of $1.93 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.18M (+5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Flowserve (NYSE:FLS): Q2 EPS of $1.93 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.18M (+5% Y/Y) misses by $20M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • VRTX

    More on Vertex Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q2 results missed estimates across the board, but...

    More on Vertex Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q2 results missed estimates across the board, but noone seems to care as the results get overshadowed by the drug maker's release of positive study data for its experimental hepatitis C drug ALS-2200. The stock jumped higher immediately after the announcement, which hit the tape a few minutes prior to its earnings. Shares have settled in 6% higher in the post-session.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • HUM

    Humana (NYSE:HUM): Q2 EPS of $2.16 may not be comparable to consensus of $2.21. Revenue of $9.7B...

    Humana (NYSE:HUM): Q2 EPS of $2.16 may not be comparable to consensus of $2.21. Revenue of $9.7B (+4.5% Y/Y). Shares -11.9%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • BGC

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC): Q2 EPS of $0.74 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.48B (-3.5% Y/Y) misses...

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC): Q2 EPS of $0.74 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.48B (-3.5% Y/Y) misses by $110M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN): Q2 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $80M misses by $6M. Company...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN): Q2 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $80M misses by $6M. Company announces strategic restructuring. Shares currently halted AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • STX

    More on Seagate's FQ4: The company is hiking its quarterly dividend to $0.32/share from a prior...

    More on Seagate's FQ4: The company is hiking its quarterly dividend to $0.32/share from a prior $0.25/share. That's good for a yield of 4.4%. Gross margin slumped to 33.6% from FQ3's 37%, in-line with the guidance provided during Seagate's July 5 warning. In supplemental comments (.pdf), Seagate estimates it accounted for 42% of the industry's 157M hard drive shipments. STX -1.1%. OCZ -11%, as investors hoping for a merger announcement sell.  Earnings call starts at 5PM PT (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    More on Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN): Q2 misses across the board. Company announces a strategic...

    More on Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN): Q2 misses across the board. Company announces a strategic restructuring which will take place over the next 12 months, and result in a headcount reduction of over 600 full time workers and reduce costs by approximately $150M annually. Shares currently halted AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACPW

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q2 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $21.7M (+13% Y/Y) beats...

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW): Q2 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $21.7M (+13% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.03B (+17% Y/Y) beats by...

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.03B (+17% Y/Y) beats by $23M. Guides FY12 higher, and announces new $1B share buyback. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    More on Cirrus Logic's FQ1: If there was any doubt an iPad Mini will be accompanying a new...

    More on Cirrus Logic's FQ1: If there was any doubt an iPad Mini will be accompanying a new iPhone, or that Cirrus is designed into both, the blowout FQ2 guidance should quell it. Cirrus is only guiding for an FQ2 gross margin of 52%-54% (FQ1 was at 54%), which suggests Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) drove a hard bargain. Opex is expected to rise 14%-23% Q/Q. The company also announces it's selling its Apex Precision Power analog chip business for $26M. Canaccord's call today was a smart one. CRUS +14.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) and fellow collaborator Alios BioPharma announce positive...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) and fellow collaborator Alios BioPharma announce positive results from a viral kinetic study of its nucleotide hepatitis C treatment ALS-2200, saying the drug was well-tolerated, and no patients discontinued due to adverse events. Based on the data, Vertex plans to begin Phase 2 studies this year of 12-week all-oral regimens. Shares +7.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX): FQ4 EPS of $2.41 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $4.48B (+57% Y/Y) misses by...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX): FQ4 EPS of $2.41 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $4.48B (+57% Y/Y) misses by $80M. $1.2B worth of shares repurchased. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ1 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $99M (+7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ1 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $99M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $1.9M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $170M-$190M, far above $129.7M consensus. Shares +16.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALM

    Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +4%) moves higher into the close after beating FQ4 estimates earlier...

    Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +4%) moves higher into the close after beating FQ4 estimates earlier today. Net income soared as a large gain from a new venture in the specialty-egg market more than offset the higher operating costs. The company noted cautiously however that feed costs are going to continue to rise over the near term due to the severe drought and damage to the national corn crop.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWI

    Shares of Armstrong World Industries (AWI -15.5%) hit an eight-month low after its Q2 misses...

    Shares of Armstrong World Industries (AWI -15.5%) hit an eight-month low after its Q2 misses estimates across the board and the company cut its sales guidance for the rest of the year. The flooring maker now says it expects residential and commercial remodeling market to contract as the domestic economic recovery decelerates and economic conditions continue to worsen in Europe. Peer Mohawk Industries (MHK -4.2%) also also weak on the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SWN

    Forecasts for continued warm weather and potential shut-downs at nuclear power plants drove...

    Forecasts for continued warm weather and potential shut-downs at nuclear power plants drove natural gas (UNG +5.9%) prices to new six-month highs, brushing $3.23/MMBtu. Prices settled just below that level with a gain of 6.6%. Nat gas names are among the top energy sector gainers: SWN +3.4%, RRC +2.6%, COG +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • GRPN

    After rebounding strongly on Friday with the help of Amazon's Q2 report and LivingSocial data...

    After rebounding strongly on Friday with the help of Amazon's Q2 report and LivingSocial data (not to mention short-covering), Groupon (GRPN -9%) has tumbled below the $7 level once again. Expect shares to remain volatile ahead of August 13's Q2 report, which should clear up whether recent fears about slumping U.S. and European billings are justified.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • EDMC

    For-profit education stocks show sharp losses after a Senate report (.pdf) widely criticizes the...

    For-profit education stocks show sharp losses after a Senate report (.pdf) widely criticizes the industry. Summing up the report quite nicely is the stat that while for-profit schools enroll only around 10% of students for higher education students in the U.S. - they account for nearly 50% of all student loan defaults. Falling the hardest: EDMC -9.1%, CECO -7.4%, ESI-OLD -7.4%, STRA -6.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • LKM

    NetQin (NQ +7%) rallies after Canaccord's Mike Walkley raises his EPS estimates on account of...

    NetQin (NQ +7%) rallies after Canaccord's Mike Walkley raises his EPS estimates on account of the Chinese mobile security software vendor's recent acquisition mobile device management software firm Beijing NationSky. Walkley praises NetQin for "wisely investing ... to support a global customer base and larger company," and expects the company to benefit from China's booming smartphone market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • ATPAQ

    Today's spike in shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +10%) appears to stem...

    Today's spike in shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +10%) appears to stem from partner Isramco's report on details around an Israeli natural gas discovery announced earlier this month. Isramco says the Shimson well offshore Israel, in which it holds a 39% stake while ATP holds 40%, was flowing at 40.2M cubic ft./day following a 54-hour test.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX +1.8%) moves up despite an S&P credit rating cut to BBB+ from A- with a...

    Barrick Gold (ABX +1.8%) moves up despite an S&P credit rating cut to BBB+ from A- with a negative outlook, reflecting higher capital spending plans even as gold production is delayed at its Pascua-Lama project. Shares could be getting a lift from a positive blog article which says ABX is undervalued, enjoys strong earnings growth, and production will pick up in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • MRVL

    Hard drive controller chip vendors Marvell (MRVL -2.1%) and LSI (LSI-OLD -1.7%) slump after...

    Hard drive controller chip vendors Marvell (MRVL -2.1%) and LSI (LSI-OLD -1.7%) slump after Williams Financial cuts its estimates on Marvell due to widespread signs of softening PC demand. Williams is also worried about slowing orders for Marvell's TD-SCDMA baseband chips, used in phones running on China Mobile's 3G network. LSI took off on Thursday following a Q2 beat. Seagate, a major Marvell and LSI customer, reports after the close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • DXTR

    Medical systems manufacturer Cardica (CRDC +5.4%) trades higher today after saying the first...

    Medical systems manufacturer Cardica (CRDC +5.4%) trades higher today after saying the first patients have been successfully treated without complications in the European clinical study of its MicroCutter cutting/stapling device. The trial is designed to evaluate devices efficacy in a variety of gastrointestinal surgical procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com (CTRP -3.3%) slumps to a three-year low as Chinese stocks trade weak. Sentiment on the...

    Ctrip.com (CTRP -3.3%) slumps to a three-year low as Chinese stocks trade weak. Sentiment on the name has also been swayed by last week's strong Q2 report from Expedia that highlighted Ctrip's more moderate growth track.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR +0.4%) jumps on news that the U.S. has agreed to set duties on Korean...

    Whirlpool (WHR +0.4%) jumps on news that the U.S. has agreed to set duties on Korean washing-machines.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -3.8%) slump after Piper Jaffray cut earnings estimates on...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -3.8%) slump after Piper Jaffray cut earnings estimates on the retailer in a research note to clients. The company isn't widely expected to realize the same bounce in sales that other retailers are forecast to see from pent-up demand for women's apparel in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • TRW

    Shares of TRW Automotive (TRW +5.5%) pop after saying its German subsidiary, TRW Deutschland,...

    Shares of TRW Automotive (TRW +5.5%) pop after saying its German subsidiary, TRW Deutschland, has settled its antitrust suit with the U.S. Department of Justice. The company has agreed to plead guilty to one count of conspiracy in restraint of trade involving sales of occupant safety products. TRW Deutschland will pay a fine of $5.1M, and under the terms of the agreement, all but one of its employees will be protected against prosecution.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +9.8%) jumps after filing a petition asking the ITC to review a judge's July 18...

    VirnetX (VHC +9.8%) jumps after filing a petition asking the ITC to review a judge's July 18 decision to terminate the investigation of a patent infringement complaint against Apple on procedural grounds. VirnetX, which had a short ratio of 12.5 as of July 13, shares crashed last week following a critical column from SA author Special K.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics (PDH +7.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, which believes...

    PetroLogistics (PDH +7.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, which believes propylene prices, which currently trade at a discount to Brent crude, will correct higher in the near term, and propane supplies remain ample due to shale gas fracking with higher propane prices not yet affecting the propylene market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (EGO +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $14.50 target price at Stifel...

    Eldorado Gold (EGO +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $14.50 target price at Stifel Nicolaus, which says with 2012 operating guidance lowered, permitting timelines extended and a substantial recent contraction in valuation, it believes heightened investor expectations have subsided.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • BIOF

    Investors should temper their enthusiasm over the agreement between BioFuel Energy (BIOF +4.8%)...

    Investors should temper their enthusiasm over the agreement between BioFuel Energy (BIOF +4.8%) and Gevo (GEVO -7.5%) to explore large-scale production of isobutanol light of the small size of the isobutanol market, Tristan Brown writes. The conversion of only a few U.S. ethanol facilities would swamp the market and drive down profits of retrofitted facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -7.9%) is the S&P 500's biggest decliner as the coal company...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -7.9%) is the S&P 500's biggest decliner as the coal company discloses that on July 25 a subsidiary received an imminent danger order for one area of its Eagle Butte Mine in Wyoming. More likely, shares are simply giving back much of Friday's outsized 20% gain on Arch Coal's better than expected Q2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • LECO

    Shares of welding-products maker Lincoln Electric (LECO -8.5%) tank after missing big on its Q2...

    Shares of welding-products maker Lincoln Electric (LECO -8.5%) tank after missing big on its Q2 report earlier today. Sales growth came in at 6.4%, which was far below expectations for the quarter and well behind the increase seen in Q1. Additionally, the company issued a cautious outlook for the second half, noting heightened uncertainty in both political and economic environments globally.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -2.4%), Citrix (CTXS -6.2%), and Red Hat (RHT -3.4%) sell off following Oracle's...

    VMware (VMW -2.4%), Citrix (CTXS -6.2%), and Red Hat (RHT -3.4%) sell off following Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) purchase of Xsigo. Citrix has a partnership with Xsigo, and VMware is buying rival Nicira. Also, all three companies have introduced solutions (I, II, III) for managing cloud and/or virtualization environments - an area Xsigo specializes in. Citrix sold off on Thursday following its Q2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • MWIV

    MWI Veterinary Supply (MWIV +12.3%) pops after its FQ3 easily beat estimates this morning on a...

    MWI Veterinary Supply (MWIV +12.3%) pops after its FQ3 easily beat estimates this morning on a 35% jump in total revenue. Organic-revenue growth jumped 20% in the quarter, excluding acquisitions, while Internet sales to independent vets and producers in the U.S. grew over 30%. The company also raised its its guidance for the year, now expecting an EPS between $4.14 - $4.20 on revenues of $2.05B - $2.065B. Street estimates are for a $4.09 EPS on revenue of $2.03B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • MTRN

    Materion (MTRN -5.2%) shares slip after benefiting from a strong market Friday, particularly for...

    Materion (MTRN -5.2%) shares slip after benefiting from a strong market Friday, particularly for metals and mining stocks, which helped support MTRN despite the company's report of disappointing Q2 results and reduced 2013 guidance. Jefferies lowers its price target on the stock to $34 from $40.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • ARQL

    Shares of biotech researcher ArQule (ARQL +4%) advanced after Needham initiates coverage with a...

    Shares of biotech researcher ArQule (ARQL +4%) advanced after Needham initiates coverage with a Buy and an $11 price target. The firm cites the development potential of its lung cancer drug, tivantinib, and recommends scooping up shares ahead of "multiple value-creating data milestones" expected over the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MDT

    Covidien (COV +1.2%) continues the rise it began on Tuesday last week ahead of its FQ3 EPS beat...

    Covidien (COV +1.2%) continues the rise it began on Tuesday last week ahead of its FQ3 EPS beat on Thursday and hits a new 52-week high of $56.21. SA author Stephen Simpson calls Covidien "a leading growth story at a reasonable price." The company today said it has received 510(NYSE:K) clearance for its Nellcor Bedside SpO2 Patient Monitoring System.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX -1.7%) says it incurred a structural failure at the Bailey Preparation Plant...

    Consol Energy (CNX -1.7%) says it incurred a structural failure at the Bailey Preparation Plant in Pennsylvania over the weekend, which could affect coal production for up to two weeks. CNX says it is conducting a thorough assessment; if one of two collapsed belts is restored, the mines could operate at 60% capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • EQIX

    Equinix (EQIX -3.9%) sells off after Citi downgrades shares to Neutral. The company has been a...

    Equinix (EQIX -3.9%) sells off after Citi downgrades shares to Neutral. The company has been a 2012 standout thanks to positive earnings reports, as well as growing bullishness about the global boom in data center construction.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -15.3%) takes a hit today after its Q2 missed bottom-line estimates this...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -15.3%) takes a hit today after its Q2 missed bottom-line estimates this morning.  The company also cut its FY12 forecast, citing uncertainty in its Argentina operations related to labor unrest, increased manufacturing spending concerns and broad supply and demand imbalances.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (JVA +9.6%) and Farmer Brothers (FARM +10.2%) post outsized gains on heavy volume...

    Coffee Holding (JVA +9.6%) and Farmer Brothers (FARM +10.2%) post outsized gains on heavy volume after rival Peet's raises the profile of the sector on M&A buzz.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • DBD

    Diebold (DBD -11.1%) trades sharply lower after missing profit estimates with its Q2 report and...

    Diebold (DBD -11.1%) trades sharply lower after missing profit estimates with its Q2 report and lowering its guidance for FY12. The company's projections were hurt by word that Brazil won't order new voting terminals ahead of elections set for this fall.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.9%) regains all and more of its big decline following last...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.9%) regains all and more of its big decline following last Wednesday's secondary offering. The company is the latest in a series (I, II, III, to name a few) of mortgage REITs issuing shares at prices well above book value. The firms take these proceeds and invest them in higher-yielding assets - the result being increased book value.
